issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
When S3 quota is exceeded, OSG does not send any error message to the client and the client keeps retrying, tested with boto and s3cmd,

{noformat}
(s3cmdEnv)[root@d-16 ~]# s3cmd -c s3cfgtest put tempfile17mb s3://quotatestbucket/testobjects3
WARNING: Module python-magic is not available. Guessing MIME types based on file extensions.
tempfile17mb -> s3://quotatestbucket/testobjects3  [1 of 1]
 11882496 of 17825792    66% in    0s    32.49 MB/s  failed
WARNING: Upload failed: /quotatestbucket/testobjects3 ([Errno 104] Connection reset by peer)
WARNING: Retrying on lower speed (throttle=0.00)
WARNING: Waiting 3 sec...
tempfile17mb -> s3://quotatestbucket/testobjects3  [1 of 1]
 12001280 of 17825792    67% in    0s    26.83 MB/s  failed
WARNING: Upload failed: /quotatestbucket/testobjects3 ([Errno 104] Connection reset by peer)
WARNING: Retrying on lower speed (throttle=0.01)
WARNING: Waiting 6 sec...
tempfile17mb -> s3://quotatestbucket/testobjects3  [1 of 1]
 10346496 of 17825792    58% in   25s   392.67 kB/s  failed
WARNING: Upload failed: /quotatestbucket/testobjects3 ([Errno 104] Connection reset by peer)
WARNING: Retrying on lower speed (throttle=0.05)
WARNING: Waiting 9 sec...
tempfile17mb -> s3://quotatestbucket/testobjects3  [1 of 1]
 10334208 of 17825792    57% in  126s    79.66 kB/s  failed
WARNING: Upload failed: /quotatestbucket/testobjects3 ([Errno 104] Connection reset by peer)
WARNING: Retrying on lower speed (throttle=0.25)
WARNING: Waiting 12 sec...
tempfile17mb -> s3://quotatestbucket/testobjects3  [1 of 1]
  3428352 of 17825792    19% in  209s    15.99 kB/s
{noformat}
fields.summary: OSG does not send any error message when quota is exceeded

[~zhill], this might be an issue with exception handling i.e. swallowing the correct exception and returning a 500 internal error to the client which may be causing the client to retry. I can take this off your plate if you have not already started working on it

After looking through the OSG code, found that OSG returns the correct HTTP error - 403 Forbidden, and S3 code - AccessDenied. I'm under the impression that S3 clients retry only when the S3 service returns a HTTP 500 error. Need to find out if S3 clients retry for 403 errors as well. The error message about quota being exceeded gets swallowed by the authorization checks which might not be simple to fix.
[~swathi], this looks like the error isn't getting back to the client properly.
[~swathi], I'm pushing this to 4.2.0 unless you have code for this already.
